title: Conor McGregor takes swipe at Floyd Mayweather ahead of UFC return

Conor McGregor has taken aim at Floyd Mayweather as he prepares to make a return to UFC.

The Irishman has announced he will fight in Las Vegas on January 18 in his first bout since he was choked out by lightweight champion Khabib Nurmagomedov last October.

McGregor's defeat to Nurmagomedov came on the back of a brief foray into boxing, when he took on pound-for-pound king Mayweather in Las Vegas in August 2017.

Mayweather stopped McGregor in the 10th round and there were suggestions the pair would face off in a rematch in the UFC octagon.

(Image: REUTERS)

McGregor admits it was on the cards and believes he more than showed his boxing capabilities.

"I went into another mans sport. The supposed best and faced him at his skill set," McGregor said.

"It was supposed to be reciprocated. I would box him, he would fight me, but it didn't turn out that way."

(Image: REUTERS)

McGregor is yet to reveal his opponent for his return fight but it is likely to be either Donald Cerrone or Justin Gaethje.

McGregor said: “I’m in prime physical condition, I’ve agreed the date with the company.

“As far as the opponent, I have the opponent’s name, but for me and the game that I’m in, and from experience, if I was to give you people the name - which I would love to do - I know the UFC would flip it because they are a crafty company.

“For me, here’s this one, ask the UFC who the opponent is because I do not give a f*** who the opponent is."
description: Conor McGregor will be back in the octagon on January 18 in only his second fight since losing to Floyd Mayweather in a boxing ring
